studyMetadata.title: Retrospective Relevance
studyMetadata.description: We want to evaluate how you edit summaries of your work

uiConfig.studyEndMsg: Thank you for completing this study. You're the best!

response.prompt: Who discovered Walter Boddy's body?
Which object is most directly linked as a potential murder weapon?
options: The candlestick found in the conservatory
A carving knife stuck in the wall of the kitchen
A broken martini glass discovered in the theater
A missing gun from the study

response.prompt: In which room was Walter Boddy's body found?
Which suspect's fingerprint was found on Walter Boddy's missing Rolex watch?
Where was Walter Boddy's missing Rolex watch found?
What best describes Adam Mustard's underlying motivation in his interactions with Walter Boddy?
options: The pursuit of lucrative business deals and personal financial gain
A covert desire to frame Boddy for financial fraud
An effort to protect Boddy's reputation by managing insider trading risks
A purely personal grudge rooted in an old rivalry unrelated to business

response.prompt: What motivated Scott Plum's actions regarding the handling of Walter Boddy's checkbook?
options: Financial desperation and resentment over a monetary grievance with Boddy
An attempt to sabotage Boddy's business ventures by stealing sensitive documents
A covert strategy to redirect funds into a rival company
A ploy to frame Adam Mustard for financial mismanagement

response.prompt: What is the primary motivation behind Antonio Green's interactions with Walter Boddy?
options: Advancing a business deal through his role as a merger and acquisition broker
Settling a personal score that stemmed from past disputes
Attempting to expose Boddy's unethical practices to the public
Organizing an elaborate scheme to embezzle funds from Boddy's estate

correctAnswer.answer: The candlestick found in the conservatory
The pursuit of lucrative business deals and personal financial gain
Financial desperation and resentment over a monetary grievance with Boddy
Advancing a business deal through his role as a merger and acquisition broker

response.prompt: Please paste the text from the researcher
response.placeholder: Please enter the output from the large language model

response.prompt: Please enter a participant ID number

SelectionTask.instruction: Please select the parts of this summary that you think will be relevant to future investigators.

testingStimulusValue.text:
# this is the first paragraph.
 There could be more here, 
 but I don't think I **will talk much** about it.
I tend to write lots of words sometimes and they can be overwhelming.

# this is markdown.
 It is a long string of text. **General Requirements:**

- **Two Main Study Pages:**
- **Text Editor (Phase 4):** For participants to edit and author a markdown paragraph.
- **Paragraph Selection (Phase 5):** For participants to mark regions of a finished paragraph for relevance.
- Three additional pages:

 - **Admin Page:** This page is for study administrators to prepare study data. Administrators can:

Pause.description: This is to pause the participant
Pause.instruction: Please pause here and wait for the next direction from the researcher.

SentenceList.instruction: Edit the paragraph below by modifying sentences, reordering them, or adding new ones.

SalmonfishTool.instruction: Please watch the following tutorial to learn about the tool you will use.

response.prompt: I consent to participate in this study.

CognitiveStylesIndex.instruction: People differ in the way they think about problems. Below are 38 statements designed to identify your own approach. If you believe that a statement is true about you, answer 'Yes'. If you believe that it is false about you, answer 'No'. If you are uncertain whether it is true or false, answer 'Uncertain'. This is not a test of your ability, and there are no right or wrong answers. Simply choose the one response which comes closest to your own opinion.

response.prompt: In my experience, rational thought is the only realistic basis for making decisions.
To solve a problem, I have to study each part of it in detail.
I am most effective when my work involves a clear sequence of tasks to be performed.
I have difficulty working with people who ‘dive in at the deep end’ without considering the finer aspects of the problem.
I am careful to follow rules and regulations at work.
I avoid taking a course of action if the odds are against its success.
I am inclined to scan through reports rather than read them in detail.
My understanding of a problem tends to come more from thorough analysis than flashes of insight.
I try to keep to a regular routine in my work.
The kind of work I like best is that which requires a logical, step-by-step approach.
I rarely make ‘off the top of the head’ decisions.
I prefer chaotic action to orderly inaction.
Given enough time, I would consider every situation from all angles.
To be successful in my work, I find that it is important to avoid hurting other people’s feelings.
The best way for me to understand a problem is to break it down into its constituent parts.
I find that to adopt a careful, analytical approach to making decisions takes too long.
I make most progress when I take calculated risks.
I find that it is possible to be too organised when performing certain kinds of task.
I always pay attention to detail before I reach a conclusion.
I make many of my decisions on the basis of intuition.
My philosophy is that it is better to be safe than risk being sorry.
When making a decision, I take my time and thoroughly consider all relevant factors.
I get on best with quiet, thoughtful people
I would rather that my life was unpredictable than that it followed a regular pattern.
Most people regard me as a logical thinker.
To fully understand the facts I need a good theory
I work best with people who are spontaneous.
I find detailed, methodical work satisfying.
My approach to solving a problem is to focus on one part at a time.
I am constantly on the lookout for new experiences.
In meetings, I have more to say than most.
My 'gut feeling' is just as good a basis for decision making as careful analysis.
I am the kind of person who casts caution to the wind.
I make decisions and get on with things rather than analyse every last detail.
I am always prepared to take a gamble.
Formal plans are more of a hindrance than a help in my work.
I am more at home with ideas rather than facts and figures.
I find that ‘too much analysis results in paralysis’.

AnalysisHolismScaleShort.instruction: Please indicate how much you agree with the following statements.

response.prompt: Everything in the universe is somehow related to each other.
It is more desirable to take the middle ground than go to extremes.
Future events are predictable based on present situations.
It is more important to pay attention to the whole context rather than the details.

HolisticCognitionScale.instruction: Please indicate how much you agree with the following statements.

response.prompt: It is impossible to understand the pieces without considering the whole picture.
It makes more sense to study things in their natural context rather than in isolation.
In a painting, the background is just as important as the main object.
Relationships between people are more important than the individuals themselves.
People are mostly independent of one another.
Events only occur as a result of individuals’ choices and behavior.
Each individual person is only responsible for his/her own actions.
People usually end up doing what they want to, irrespective of norms or expectations.
Something can be both ugly and beautiful at the same time.
In any given situation, what it means to do the right thing depends on who you ask.
It is better to reach a compromise than to argue your point of view.
Even two seemingly contradictory ideas can each yield something valuable.
An honest person can be expected to stay honest in the future.
A person’s true nature may evolve but it does not change dramatically over time.
It is useful to make future projections based on the present situation.
The course of human history is best described as gradual linear progress.

BigFivePersonalityScale.instruction: Please indicate how much you agree with the following statements.

response.prompt: Am the life of the party.
Talk to a lot of different people at parties.
Don't talk a lot.
Keep in the background.
Sympathize with others' feelings.
Feel others' emotions.
Am not really interested in others.
Am not interested in other people's problems.
Get chores done right away.
Like order.
Often forget to put things back in their proper place.
Make a mess of things.

Demographics.instruction: Please answer the following questions about yourself.

response.prompt: What is your age?
How do you identify your gender?
What is your current level of education?
What is your major or primary field of study?
Do you have a minor or secondary field of study? If so, please specify.
Which field best describes your primary area of study?
options: Social Sciences (Psychology, Sociology, Political Science, etc.)
Arts & Design (Visual Arts, Performing Arts, Media, etc.)
Health Sciences (Medicine, Nursing, Public Health, etc.)

response.prompt: Are you enrolled as a full-time or part-time student?
How do you primarily fund your education?
Are you currently working while pursuing your studies?
Are you a first-generation college student (neither parent/guardian has a four-year degree)?
Are you an international student?
Have you previously participated in sensemaking or investigative tasks (e.g., research, data analysis, intelligence work)?
If yes, how frequently do you engage in such tasks?
response.secondaryText: select 'I don't know' if you selected 'No' above

response.prompt: If yes, how many years of professional experience do you have in roles that involve analytical or investigative tasks?
response.secondaryText: select 'I don't know' if you selected 'No' above

response.prompt: Which best describes your typical approach when processing complex information?
options: I focus on the details first and then build the big picture
I look at the big picture first and then fill in the details
I try to balance both simultaneously

response.prompt: How confident are you in your ability to summarize complex information?
How often do you perform manual text editing or summarization in your work or studies?
How would you rate your problem-solving abilities?
How would you describe your attention to detail?
How much do you trust automated summary tools compared to manual summarization?
